results.title: Cottage gardens
results.creator_credit: Tracy Smith and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gardening Australia”.
Jane Edmanson and the Gardening Australia team provide all the information you need to create your own cottage garden. Planting, planning and design techniques are shown, and suggestions are made in regards to which plants should go where and why.

results.title: The Loom never stops : a conversation with Thomas Ladgrove
results.creator_credit: Thomas Ladgrove and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: When Thomas Ladgrove started work at Brintons carpet factory in 1967, he was a ward of the state. He eventually started working with the loom and became the youngest weaver in Australia and England at age 18. He describes his work on the loom as well as staff morale when it became clear that Brintons was suffering, the subsequent rumours and worry and then the closure when the announcement to cease operations was made.

results.title: Jane Edmanson's guide to houseplants
results.creator_credit: Ernest Heffelmyer, Gardening Australia Magazine and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gardening Australia”.
Jane Edmandson hosts this “Gardening Australia” special on houseplants which covers plant selection, containers and accessories, maintenance, repotting, dealing effectively with pests and diseases, over and underwatering, propagation by cuttings and division, popular flowering and foliage plants, unusual plants such as cacti, orchids and Bonsai, terrariums, holiday care and plant scaping.

results.title: Australia : the Land of my dreams = Kraj moich marzen
results.creator_credit: Mariola Gorna and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Born in Poland, Mariola chose to come to Australia. After a long wait in Greece, she was finally granted the right to immigrate to Australia. She tells of the second family she found at Brintons carpet factory and how they were there for her during some of her most difficult times.

results.title: The Journey begins at midnight
results.creator_credit: Joseph Jovic and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Josip tells of his upbringing on a farm in Coatia and how the lure of a better life brought him to Australia, Geelong and, eventually, to Brintons Carpets. Learning English within a few years, Josip soon became a shop steward and a representative on the Consultative Committee and he tells of the closure of Brintons and how it led to his retirement.

results.title: Geelong TCUFA : weaving and winding : more than a job : Digital Storytelling project
results.brief_description: Five employees of carpet manufacturer Brintons and Textile Clothing and Footwear Union tell about their lives before, during and after working at Brintons. The factory closed in June 2008, leaving 100 people without jobs.

results.title: Observation
results.brief_description: The space station Observation is twirling through the cosmos, the power cut and the crew missing. Players must help solve the mystery by taking control of SAM (Systems Administration Maintenance), the station’s AI software that’s based on HAL from Stanley Kubrick’s 2001: A Space Odyssey (1968).

constellations_primary.name: Evil AI, dystopias and production design
constellations_primary.description: In No Code’s sci-fi thriller players take command of a multi-national space station’s artificial intelligence system to help the sole survivor solve the mystery of a missing crew and why the station is wildly off course.

results.description:
The space station Observation is twirling through the cosmos, the power cut and the crew missing. The station’s lone occupant is Dr Emma Fisher, who players must help solve the mystery by taking control of SAM (Systems Administration Maintenance), the station’s AI software that’s based on HAL from Stanley Kubrick’s 2001: A Space Odyssey (1968). This sci-fi thriller draws inspiration from many similar interstellar-set horror stories and puts players in command of a potentially malevolent AI.

The developers were intrigued by the question of whether AI could even be evil or if its code had somehow failed it. Observation players get to explore that idea, and their actions as SAM affect the game world and story.
description_for_label:
The space station Observation is twirling through the cosmos, the power cut and the crew missing. The station’s lone occupant is Dr Emma Fisher, who players must help solve the mystery by taking control of SAM (Systems Administration Maintenance), the station’s AI software that’s based on HAL from Stanley Kubrick’s 2001: A Space Odyssey (1968). This sci-fi thriller draws inspiration from many similar interstellar-set horror stories and puts players in command of a potentially malevolent AI.

The developers were intrigued by the question of whether AI could even be evil or if its code had somehow failed it. Observation players get to explore that idea, and their actions as SAM affect the game world and story.

results.title: Formal gardens
results.creator_credit: Bruce Franchini, Stuart Crowner and Perennial Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Gardens of the world”.
Audrey Hepburn travels through the rich evolution of formal garden design in some of the world’s most spectacular settings - from the Renaissance gardens of Italy, (Villa Gamberaia, Villa Lante, Villa La Pietra), the grand 17th century gardens of France, (Chateau de Courances, Versailles), to the lushly planted gardens of England, (Hidcote Manor, Tintinhull House). Narrated by Michael York.

results.title: Tulips and spring bulbs
results.creator_credit: Bruce Franchini, Stuart Crowner and Perennial Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Gardens of the world”.
The vast, colourful bulb fields of our host audrey Hepburn’s native Holland are only a small part of a complex cultural phenomenon. Here bulbs are intertwined with the history and art of an entire country. The transformation from sleeping bulb to elegant bloom is miraculous. Narcissus, hyacinth, muscari and bluebells share the stage with the favourite, the tulip, for a grand tour of the spectacular Kreukenhof in Holland and Chenics Manor, in England and more. Hosted by Audrey Hepburn and narrated by Michael York.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce Franchini, Stuart Crowner and Perennial Productions

results.title: Flower gardens
results.creator_credit: Bruce Franchini, Stuart Crowner and Perennial Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Gardens of the world”.
Perhaps no garden in the world exhibits a more exhilirating use of flowers than Claude Monet’s garden at Giverny. Monet’s exuberant palette of colours strikingly contrasts with the grace and elegance of the classic perennial borders found at Tintinhull House in Somerset, England. The native flora of America’s southeast further illustrate the range of aesthetics and pleasure found in the world’s most beautiful flower gardens. Hosted by Audrey Hepburn and narrated by Michael York.
